comments:
I've installed my own JVM in a root directory JRE_ROOT. This JRE_ROOT directory
structure looks like:

JRE_ROOT
\_ lib
|   \_ rt.jar
\_ bin
    \_ java
    \_ javaw

After registering my JVM in the "Preferences" pane, I can run any java program.
But if I try to launch a program in debug mode, eclipse reports an error:

NullPointerException in StandardVMDebugger(line:296).

The file libraryInfos.xml in the plugins metadata directory
($workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.launching) doesn't take my JRE
into account and I guess the problem could be closely related to this curious
thing.

Maybe my JRE is not compliant with eclipse's hard-coded assumptions? In that
case, where could I find specification on JREs packaging?
Please attach the entire stack trace for the NPE

Hello Daring, here's the complete stack trace I get when I launch my program. I
hope this will help you find the bug.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger.getJavaVersion(StandardVMDebugger.java:296)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:159)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate(JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:109)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:732)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:904)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Session data are:

eclipse.buildId=1200411050810
java.version=1.4.2_05 by Sun Microsystems
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=motif, NL=en_US

This is a dup of bug 77886, which is now fixed. Perhaps you vm did not have 
a "java.vm.version" system property? This too has been changed to use 
the "java.version" property instead (bug 87039).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 77886 ***
